column4: hm, after enabling compiz i can't login to gnome, anyone know how to get back to metacity again?
choose gnome failsafe from the sessions menu of the greeter
then you can fix the startup in your session
ok, will try that, thanks
not even failsafe gnome works :(
the command i used was 'compiz --replace --indirect-rendering --strict-binding'
i've never broken gnome that much. sorry, i can't help more
and you didn't put it into your session startup programs?
you probably forgot to add "gconf" to the end of the command
no, gconf was there as well
you might find something relating to compiz in ~/.config/autostart/
will check that now
no autostart in there
where did you put the compiz command?
in a terminal
then i can't see that it would have broken gnome permanently
neither can i, but so it did :)
that's what i've been looking for
does your .xsession-errors file give any clue?
nope :(
gnome-settings-daemon starts, but nothing happens after that
well done
